passage_text: 1. enigmatic -- not clear to the understanding; I didn't grasp the meaning of that enigmatic comment until much later; prophetic texts so enigmatic that their meaning has been disputed for centuries. synonyms: enigmatical, puzzling. Source: WordNet 3.0.

LINK / CITE ADD TO WORD LIST. adjective. The definition of enigmatic is something that is like a puzzle or riddle that can’t be understood. An example of enigmatic is the mysterious ending of a complicated movie. of or like an enigma; perplexing; baffling.

en·ig·mat·ic. adj. Of or resembling an enigma; puzzling: a professor's enigmatic grading system. See Synonyms at mysterious. [Greek. , from. , riddle; see enigma .]. en′ig·mat′i·cal·ly adv. (ˌɛn ɪgˈmaet ɪgˈmæt; ɪk also ˌi-). nɪg. adj
